While her origins are unknown, I think it is safe to say she is an instructor of some sort, one that does not mind getting physical, if her comment on broken bones is any indication.

I am most excited to see this new champion school our current roster.

That pun...an upvote for you. 

A champion who is a teacher sounds interesting. Any other champions fulfill that role?  I don't think Yi does because he isn't mainly a teacher, rather he took on a pupil with no intention to do so beforehand. 

And I don't know about Karma.

I am not sure if she is a teacher per se, as she sounds extremely confrontational, if the quote is an accurate translation. Mentor or instructor sounds more appropriate, even if teaching is her primary objective; teach by example sort of thing.

A new Rakkor Tribe/Mount Targon champion, perhaps? It's been over three years since the last one. Meddler did say the next champion would be a real figure in Runeterra, in contrast to recent folklore types.

That's exactly what I though! The voice over reminds me a lot of Diana, just a little grittier.

Although i don't really think there is room for a new champion in the Solari tribe lore... maybe the rakkor? Probably not.

Well, technically, the Solari are from the Rakkor tribe, right? And by extension, so is Diana, since she was born into the Solari.

I don't really have anything to go on in saying she might be Rakkor, except their Spartan-like warrior culture. Some people are saying the name sounds Ionian.

I agree about Ionia, that was my first reaction the name. I would place my bets on it being an Ionian champion since the last one we had was Yasuo, and Ionia is pretty lacking in lore.  

I hope its Mt. Targon though because Ionian champs are really generic IMO.

{{champion:64}} - DnD Monk
{{champion:11}} - Skinny Samurai
{{champion:157}} - Not as Skinny Samurai
{{champion:5}} - Chinese General

Recently we've been getting some really creative champions in terms of artistic style and story, it will be a shame if we get "Female Samurai"

I realized after this post that {{champion:39}} and {{champion:103}} are pretty creative but I still stand by my point lol.

Well, considering Ionia is basically fake Japan, their champions are going to reflect that influence. Samurai, ninja, monks, kitsune, mystical warriors, and the like. Don't forget Karma, who is basically a Daoshi.

The champion select quote we have strongly suggests this new champion uses either fists or a blunt weapon, not a sword. Real samurai used a variety of weapons, but pop culture ones use swords. I have to say, though, I wouldn't argue with a kanabo-wielding one, if that were to happen. Maybe she could have armor-crushing abilities. Broken bones as lessons really reads "Spartan", to me, though, so I'm still leaning towards Rakkor.

By the way, Xin Zhao is Demacian and a former Zaun gladiator slave. I suppose he could have originally been from Ionia, but he's not talking, so there's no telling.

Maybe it will be like Ekko.A few of his champ select quotes [were released to the PBE](http://www.surrenderat20.net/p/59-pbe-cycle.html) during the 5.9 PBE cycle.Then he was reveal & added to the PBE for the [5.10 PBE cycle](http://www.surrenderat20.net/p/510-pbe.html).If we think about it that way,then it's possible the new champ is coming to the PBE in the 5.22 PBE cycle,which should be starting next week assuming we're on the usual 2 week cycle. 
It's also possible Illaoi may have a preview released at the Worlds Semifinals like Ekko.
That is the general consensus it seems.
